thread.title: Bruce Springsteen's 'Born to Run' house up for sale in N.J.
thread.title_full: Bruce Springsteen's 'Born to Run' house up for sale in N.J. - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Bruce Springsteen's 'Born to Run' house up for sale in N.J.
text:
Google The house where Bruce Springsteen wrote "Born to Run" while he lived in Long Branch, New Jersey, is up for sale. It’s Br ce’s old ho se!
The humble Jersey shore home where a 25-year-old Bruce Springsteen wrote the songs for his 1975 classic “Born To Run” is up for sale — and priced to move like a chrome-wheeled, fuel-injected muscle car.
The 828-square-foot house just a block and a half off the beach in Long Branch is back on the market for $299,000. Within its four walls, the Boss penned all eight songs on the album, from opener “Thunder Road” through epic closer “Jungleland.”
“Now is your chance to own a little piece of New Jersey rock and roll history!” reads the listing for the home at 7 1/2 West End Court. Springsteen lived in the residence in 1974-75.
Fin Costello/Redferns Bruce lived at the house from 1974 to 1975. Springsteen wrote the songs for his 1975 classic “Born To Run” while he lived at 7 1/2 West End Court. Previous Next Enlarge The one-story house comes with two bedrooms, a single bathroom and a small front porch. It sold for $280,000 six years ago when it last went on the block.
The legendary Rock and Roll Hall of Famer’s modest pre-stardom residence has become a bit of a tourist attraction, with Bruce buffs from around the world popping in.
lmcshane@nydailynews.com
